subject: Investing
title: What a Stock Chart Actually Shows
description: One-minute skill: What a Stock Chart Actually Shows.

hook.text: A stock chart shows price over time. Some people see patterns. Others see expensive ink-blot tests.

buildup.text: Candlestick charts show open, high, low, and close for each period. Green means the stock rose; red means it fell.

discovery.text: Moving averages smooth the noise. A 200-day moving average shows the long-term trend under daily chaos.

twist.text: Academic research finds most chart patterns have no predictive power. They describe the past, not the future.

climax.text: Charts are useful for context â€” seeing where a stock has been. They're dangerous as crystal balls.

punchline.text: A chart tells you where a stock was. Not where it's going.

quiz.question: What does academic research say about most chart patterns?
options: They have no reliable predictive power
They predict the future with 90% accuracy
